meanings.definition: The quality of being extremely unpleasant or disgusting.
meanings.sent1: The loathsomeness of the garbage dump made me cover my nose.
meanings.sent2: The movie was filled with scenes of loathsomeness that made me feel sick.
meanings.sent3: The loathsomeness of the spoiled milk in the fridge was a rude awakening.
meanings.sent4: The loathsomeness of the crime scene left a lasting impression on the detective.
meanings.sent5: The loathsomeness of the slimy creature haunted my dreams.

meanings.definition: A feeling of intense dislike or disgust.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't hide her loathsomeness towards the bully who made fun of her.
meanings.sent2: The sight of the spider filled her with loathsomeness and fear.
meanings.sent3: His loathsomeness towards broccoli was comical at family dinners.
meanings.sent4: The loathsomeness in her voice was evident when she spoke of her ex-boyfriend.
meanings.sent5: The loathsomeness in the air was palpable as they entered the haunted house.
